intro: Conyza hochstetterii, commonly known as the Hochstetter's weed, is an annual flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its small yellow flowers appear in clusters, and it produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by the wind. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields.
